messages.subject: Interesting Info from Japan...
messages.msgSnippet: secretarytocapt3 crying tears of joy... now, I admit my hands were shaking a bit when I had to open my email inbox (fear of more nutty emails)...lo and behold
messages.messageBody:
secretarytocapt3 crying tears of joy...
now, I admit my hands were shaking a bit when I had to open my email
inbox (fear of more nutty emails)...lo and behold "Hi from Japan"

secretarytocapt3 thinks "oh no not MORE Japanese junk mail"

turns out that being a total P.I.T.A** on Japanese Shinsengumi related
messageboards has paid off..

momoiro-usagi found us and has taken upon his/herself to use a
translation software to add more info to our board...via email
by the way I asked what software was used because the English is very
very good...

so friends please head on over to http://www.shinsengumimb.com and if
you have been diligently using the "mark forum" read function then the
brand new updates should show up immediately...all of momoiro-usagi's
words are in italics and I didn't edit/speculate (why do I hear a sigh
of relief from all of you?)

What is not on the messageboard is...
momoiro-usagi says that he/she can't understand all of our posts...so
maybe we have to use simple English especially in the history threads
because momoiro seems to be concentrating on these questions

strangely, momoiro has picked up on our babelfish jokes...
"At first, the meaning of "the manual laborer year three" was not able
to understand to me.
And when I have understood it, I laughed heartily.
Truly, it is the troubled fish."

Teasers:
Hijikata was good with scissors...
Hijikata hanging out in the Shinsengumi cemetary...
Mystery woman info...
Nagakura was ALSO a runaway...rebel...(probably had issues with his dad)

So please send good karmic thoughts to momoiro-usagi who spent alot of
time composing a very long email
